solution_line_template: Elvis makes {elvis_num_squares} squares with {elvis_matchsticks_per_square} matchsticks each for a total of {elvis_num_squares}*{elvis_matchsticks_per_square} = <<{elvis_num_squares}*{elvis_matchsticks_per_square}={elvis_total_matchsticks}>>{elvis_total_matchsticks} matchsticks

Ralph makes {ralph_num_squares} squares with {ralph_matchsticks_per_square} matchsticks each for a total of {ralph_matchsticks_per_square}*{ralph_num_squares} = <<{ralph_num_squares}*{ralph_matchsticks_per_square}={ralph_total_matchsticks}>>{ralph_total_matchsticks} matchsticks
They used a total of {elvis_total_matchsticks}+{ralph_total_matchsticks} = <<{elvis_total_matchsticks}+{ralph_total_matchsticks}={total_used_matchsticks}>>{total_used_matchsticks} matchsticks
There will be {initial_matchsticks}-{total_used_matchsticks} = <<{initial_matchsticks}-{total_used_matchsticks}={matchsticks_left}>>{matchsticks_left} matchsticks left in the box
